intro: Lespedeza eriocarpa var. falconeri, commonly known as the Falconeri Lespedeza, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine, soft hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This variety is often found in moist, well-drained soils in open woodlands and along stream banks.
